snippet.title: The Abercrombie & Fitch cofounder built a castle just north of New York City -- and it's yours for $US3.7 million
snippet.content:
If you've ever dreamed of living in a castle with , you're in luck. Located just over an hour north of midtown Manhattan, 249 Croton Dam Road in Ossining, New York is on the market for $US3.69 million.
Built in the 1920s by David Abercrombie, cofounder of Abercrombie & Fitch, the castle is dubbed "Elda Castle" after the first initials of his four children, according to . The castle, , served as an oasis for the Abercrombie family after they endured the tragic deaths of two of the four children: Lucy in 1929, and David in 1937.
Currently in disrepair, the buyer of the castle will have to take on a full renovation project to make it livable again.
